intro: Connarus turgidus, commonly known as the swollen connarus, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy appearance. Connarus turgidus is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
